title: Ticket #6941: add a json output option to the userlog and event log
description: We should have a key/value form for the event log and userlog. The current XML form is sort of that, but hard much harder to parse than simple key/value form would be. Json would be a better choice, and since we already have classad -> json unparser, this would be only a small amount of work.
remarks:
2019-May-30 11:30:23 by johnkn:
Two options are added to the configuration for the userlog and for the eventlog. see #6936 for the introduction of these configuration knobs.

Two knobs will be added, but not documented that allows a system administrator to opt in to ISO 8601 dates and/or UTC for all user job logs and for the global event log. These knobs will be 

config fragment
# this controls format of the EventLog
EVENT_LOG_FORMAT_OPTIONS=UTC,ISO_DATE,SUB_SECOND
# this sets default format options for job's Log and DagmanLog
DEFAULT_USERLOG_FORMAT_OPTIONS=UTC,ISO_DATE,SUB_SECOND
permitted values for these two knobs will be zero or one of these formatting case-insensitive values:

  • JSON - format events as json
  • XML - format events as xml
  • LEGACY - turn off UTC, ISO_DATE and SUB_SECOND flags so that older versions of HTCondor can read the userlog and/or eventlog.

and zero or more of the options case-insensitive flag values:

  • UTC - print the date and time as UTC with a trailing Z as the timezone
  • ISO_DATE - print the date as YYYY-MM-DD
  • SUB_SECOND - print a fractional seconds value

These options may be prefixed by a ! to turn the option off, although at present there is no need to do this because all options are set to off by default in the code. In the 8.9 series, we plan to change the compile time default to UTC,ISO_DATE and at that time, an admin can go back to the older date/time format by configuring !UTC,!ISO_DATE or by configuration LEGACY

2019-May-30 11:43:44 by johnkn:
Currently, there is no way for the user to opt in to these formatting options for their own logs. the options can only be set by the schedd/shadow configuration.

There is a hack to allow the user to turn on json userlog. If UserLogUseXML=2, then Json will be enabled rather than XML. This hack is not supported by condor_submit however. so +UserLogUseXML must be used to get this behavior. this work will be #7082
